intro: Senecio herzogii, commonly known as the Herzog's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it is often found in open, sunny habitats.
